meanings.definition: Move in an exaggerated or angry manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to flounce around when she's upset.
meanings.sent2: The child flounced out of the room after being scolded.
meanings.sent3: Her dramatic flounce out of the party made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the curtains flounce like a dancer on stage.
meanings.sent5: He flounced away, leaving a trail of frustration behind.

meanings.definition: A strip of material gathered or pleated on one edge.
meanings.sent1: The dress had a beautiful flounce at the hem.
meanings.sent2: She added a flounce to the curtains for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent3: The flounce on the pillow gave it a fancy look.
meanings.sent4: The waves of the ocean had a flounce as they crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's skirt had a flounce that twirled with her movements.
